text: This is a really great coffee stout, serenely smooth, coffee-forward yet never one-note, just great stuff overall, reminding that Shaun is a master of many arts.

Robust black pour with one finger of espresso brown head. Pretty. I get blackstrap molasses and burnt sugar in the aroma. Rich coffee and dark fruit skins. Bitter black coffee in the flavor. Full bodied and coating on the palate. Black cherry skins and currant on the finish.

500ml bottle (thx, Jonathan J.!) shared with mom. Bottled on Dec-2016. Pours a very dark brown with a huge dark brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, some hops. Taste is slightly sweet, some fruitiness, coffee, roasted malt. Good stuff.

500mL bottle. Pours black with a medium tan head. Aroma is lots of coffee and roast and cocoa. Taste is coffee, roast, oats, caramel, and a little vanilla. Bitter, roasty finish. Medium/medium-full body. Soft carbonation. Thick-ish, creamy, somewhat sticky mouthfeel.

Draft pour on tap at Fools Gold (New York City, NY). Deep blackish hue, dark and near opaque with frothy brown head. Good ringer, solid lacing. Aromas cocoa, coffee, oatmeal, roast. A bit of caramel but more bitter, toasty. Initial is medium bodied, a touch more full. Toasty, roasty, caramelized yet creamy. Bitter yet flavorful. An espresso, cocoa dusting. Caramel, a touch ofcoretzel. Firm body yet the nature occur roast and bitter flow, creamy middle seem to make it fliw realltbnicelt. Real nice stuff.

Bottle to chalice. Oily jet black with a short lived brown head. Nose is slight char, little vanilla, hint of coffee. Palate is delicately balanced coffee, caramel, maybe a little marshmallow sugary sweetness. Mouth feel is an interesting experience starting smooth and creamy, penetrated by a fine carb, finishing warm and pleasantly boozy. Sticky lips. Wow, now I understand what a stout should be.

Opaque brown color, tiny brownish head. Aroma is toasted with cocoa and vanilla. Medium to full-bodied. Lots of cocoa and coffee in the toasted flavor. Smooth and balanced.
UPDATED: MAR 11, 2017 Delicious. Lots of mild coffee. Creamy from oats and sweet. How is this not a sweet stout? Patrick, thanks again! Delicious.
[2/5/17] Bottle at Amits place in Poughkeepsie. Thanks Amit. Black with a big tan head. Aroma of coffee, roast. Sweetish-bitterish flavor, light sourish roasty note. Rounded mouthfeel. Very nice.

Bouteille datée du 08/12/2016, bue après un peu plus de deux mois. Robe noire bien opaque surmontée dun généreux col de mousse beige foncée et onctueux qui seffondre tranquillement en laissant une forte dentelle. Arômes de malt torréfié et café noisette principalement, cacao en poudre, bois sec, amande râpée et biscuit à lavoine. En bouche, mélange de café frais moulu et de malt grillé à point suivi de près par un chocolat noir lisse et onctueux qui colle longuement au palais. Également, saveurs de bois, noisettes grillées, avoine alourdie par leau, légère amertume herbacée. Bel équilibre des saveurs. Lajout de café rehausse le tout en amenant ce stout à lavoine près dun porter robuste. Texture assez douce et onctueuse, corps moyen à rond. Très bien.
Bardzo prosty, lekki, pijalny Stout z mega fajnym profilem kawy. Świetna paloność, długi, bogaty w gorzką czekoladę finisz. Mógłbym pić szklankami.

500ml bottle purchased at Hill Farmstead. Pours black with a big, thick mocha head with frothy micro bubbles leaving huge lacing. Smells like straight coffee, espresso beans, smooth oats and malted barley. Tastes like smooth quality coffee, roasted barley. Delicious. Great full, carbonated mouthfeel. Another banger from Hill. Good Job.

500 ml bottle to snifter, dated 08.17.15 (shared with the Mrs; thanks DuffMan). Looks good; a slightly translucent dark brownish cola with foamy beige head. Smells and tastes good too; a nice balance of dark malt, chocolate, hops, coffee, and mild roast. Mouthfeel is medium-bodied and pleasantly bitter. A delicious stout.

Got in a BIF from oline73. 500 ml bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 1/13/2016. Pours pitch black color with a 2 finger dense dark brown head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass. Aromas of big dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, toasted oats, caramel, dark bread, toffee, herbal, and floral; with lighter notes of pepper, nuttiness, smoke, char, dark fruit, and roast/toasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of dark/roast/bready malt, coffee, and moderate earthy hop notes; with great strength. Taste of big dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, toasted oats, caramel, dark bread, toffee, herbal, and floral; with lighter notes of pepper, nuttiness, smoke, char, dark fruit, and roast/toasted earthiness. Moderate roast/char and herbal/spicy hop bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, toasted oats, caramel, dark bread, toffee, herbal, floral, and roast/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt, coffee, and moderate earthy hop flavors; with a great roast/hop bitter/sweet balance, and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light dryness from roast/hop bitterness, increasing through the glass. Medium carbonation and medium-full body; with a very smooth, creamy/silky/bready, and lightly sticky/chalky balanced mouthfeel that is awesome. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warmth lingering after the finish. Overall this is an outstanding oatmeal stout! All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt, coffee, and moderate earthy hop flavors; very smooth and easy to drink. The coffee has faded a fair amount as expected given the bottle dating; but this is still a wonderfully well balanced, complex, and spot on example of the style. A highly enjoyable offering.

22 oz bottle shared by Huhzubendah, thanks Matt! Black with light tan head. Aromas of dark chocolate, roasty notes, light vanilla. Tastes of dark chocolate, roasty notes, caramel. Full body with a dry finish. Nice stout.
Some sharp roast notes and dark chocolate. Light coffee. Black pour with good head and lacing. Bitter finish with caramel note. Bottle thanks to Hauzebender or whatever Matts handle is.

Thanks Huhzubendah for sharing the bottle! Poured into a snifter 
showing coffee rims, black center, and a finger of clean white foam.

The nose shows extremely deep and intense roasted coffee notes. This is a big one. 

The palate is moderately carbonated and light bodied. Very light flavors of coffee with a burnt bitterness on the finish. Very thin on the palate and a big disjunct between the nose and palate, but not bad.

Due to artificial lighting, arbitrary rating for Appearance. Slightly aged sample  Pouring viscously. Toffee,  coffee beans  from the chocolate shop, and some real coffee. Sweet chocolate, mocha, coffee. Finish yields more bitter coffee,  café glacé. Well-bodied, slickness with the velvet from oatmeal. Quite good stout with a lot of coffee.  Thanks to M & L V!
Bottle @ ZZT 2016-1. Black pour. Aroma of roasted coffee and cacao. Nice taste of coffee, licorice, roasted creamy malt and mocha. I like this.

Bottle @ ZZT 2016-1, small sample. Thanks all for sharing! Dark color, medium frothy head. Aroma of oatmeal cookie, coffee. Smooth coffee in taste, soft bitterness, slight cookie sweetness. Nicely balanced. Good beer.

Thank you Benzai! 500 ml. bottle sampled @ ZZT 2016-1. Bottled 13 JAN 2016. Blackish brown, little brown bubbles. Nose is massive cold roasted coffee, very grainy coffee, herbal coffee, roasted coffee, Vaguely some malt but coffee totally dominates. Taste is cold coffee, low herbal coffee, grainy roasted, herbal, faint malts. Quite bitter in the finish, soft carbonation. Decent & enjoyable brew, coffee totally dominates everything, zero balance, interplay. I still dont really get why Hill Farmstead fanboys keep talking about how balanced their beers are.

Pitch black colour, tan head. Coffee aroma, sour note, roasted malts, cacao, oats. Light sour flavour, coffee, bitter roasted malts. Finish coffee, lots of bitterness. Quite nice.(from 50cL bottle @ ZZT 2016-1. Thanks for sharing, Benzai!)

Sampled from bottle @ ZZT 2016-1. Opaque pitch black color, medium sized light to medium brown colored head that lasts for a long time. Aroma is malts, massive coffee, dark chocolate, mocha. Taste malts, dark malts, soft roast, dark chocolate, coffee, mocha, bitter. Medium body, soft carbonation. Very nice.
Bottle @ ZZT 2016-1. Black with a small light brown head. Smells coffee, roasty, cocoa, very nice. Tastes like described in the smell. Pretty great. Full body, soft carbo.

Bottle shared by a friend. Darkest brown pour with a thick tan head. Aroma of malt, raisin, roast and coffee. Malty and chocolatey flavor with raisin and roasty coffee before a bitter dark chocolate finish.

Draught @ Mikkeller bar, Aarhus
Pours black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, caramel and brown sugar. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long roasted, chocolate, coffee, caramel and brown sugar finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Bottle. Aroma is burnt marshmallow and coffee. Tastes like creamy coffee, marshmallow, mild char and cocoa. Very soft carbonation. Medium to full body. Just a great smooth beer.

bottle shared by a friend. latest batch. poured a deep dark black colour with a nice big mocha coloured head. while pouring the nose is hit with a big deep roasted coffee aroma. subtle roasted malt notes, sweet oatmeal, sweet bakers chocolate. taste of strong coffee, mocha, roast, and sweet charred chocolate, leading to a balanced hop coffee bitterness. the oats gives this beer a bit more smoother mouthfeel. maybe just a little bit light bodied.

50 cl bottle. Thanks VastActiv!
Pours black color with a large beige head. Strong coffee roast on the nose, roast and wood. Flavor is extra smooth, lots of coffee roast, hop bitterness, chocolate, malts and faint cocoa. Super smooth and balanced, excellent.

Bottle 0.5l at Laitis, Helsinki. Bottled Feb 2016. Colour is dark brown with small brownish head. Aromas and flavors: Massive coffee, dark chocolate and roasted malts. Very soft and nice.

500ml bottle, thanks VastActiv! Pours pitch black with a thick foamy head. Aroma of coffee, roasty malts, chocolate, mocha, herbal hops and vanilla. Taste is roasty malty, heavy with coffee, mocha, dark chocolate and herbal hoppiness. Finish is hoppy, roasty and heavy with coffee notes, mocha, dark chocolate, hints of vanilla and espresso. Quite tasty and balanced coffee stout.

50 cl bottle @ home. Bottled 13.02.2016
Aroma has ash, coffee and some licorice. Flavour has pot coffee, lots of ash, some grapefruity hops and gooseberry bush. I like the licorice and ashy tones here. Oh, and also the coffee tones are nice. But alas, this is too hoppy to be completely enjoyable. Also CO2 level is a bit too high.

500 ml bottle. Pours a pitch black colour with a dark beige head. Aroma is super rich with roasted coffee, some chocolate, roasted malts and oatmeal. Flavour of super rich roastiness, coffee, grassy bitterness, heavy floral notes, dark espresso and oatmeal. Full bodied. Oily mouthfeel. Super rich, super roasty, super tasty.

Draught. Creamy lightbrown excellent fully lasting head. Black colour. Heavy malty and moderate hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter wonderfull complex flavor.Long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate. World class.

Sample at Prohibition Pig with koleminer20. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, robust. Appearance is black, light brown head, looked thick. Taste is roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, rich and robust, good. Mouthfeel is medium to heavy body, light carbonation, dark chocolate and coffee aftertaste. Overall, this is one hell of a stout.
Pour black with a fine brown head. coffee aromas, lots of roasted malts, light caramel notes, nutty. taste light sweet, medium bitter, medium bodied, average carbonation.

Huge thanks to Jordan for this one, thanks cuz! Pours out a darker cola color with a moderate tan head. Aroma is of some coffee, smooth medium roasty notes, caramel. Taste is complex, super smooth with notes of sweet caramel, medium roast coffee, light chocolate, some toffee. Really nice beer. Super smooth.

Thanks J!! Pours super dark brown/black with a rich brown head. The smell is mild coffee, chocolate, dark roasted malt. The taste is coffee, dark chocolate, dark roasted malt ending dry and roasty. The body is medium with average carbonation.

Draft @ Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate aroma. Roasted malty chocolate flavor with bitter coffee. Has a roasted malty bitter chocolate and coffee finish.

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2016 500ml bottle, bottled on 1.3.16. Aroma: strong lactose mixed with coffee and roasted malt. App: pitch black with huge pure moka brown head and big lacing. Taste and palate: full creamy body, smooth, light bitter and smokey finish. Overall: an oatmeal stout really made. Im usually not a fan of lactose beers but this is really well made and not hard to drink at all. Its the other way around. Really really smooth and not to sweet. Really well done.
From a bottle at home thanks to Huzubendah! Pours a black with a tan head. Aroma of coaoa and coffee. Flavors of toasted malt. Wonderfully smooth. Yum.

Dégustée en compagnie de Mademoiselle Irina qui rédige en ce moment son plaidoyer de non culpabilité pour une contredanse routière. Le liquide qui emplit ma coupe arborant fièrement les armoiries de la Brasserie est dun noir rutilant. En coulant dans mon verre, le liquide me paraît léger et en roulant, laisse sur les parois de mon verre une pré-mousse à la lente ascension vers une ligne déquilibre nette comme lhorizon. Mon verre reste décoré et tacheté comme un léopard dune dentelle des plus serrées et artistiques. Nez délicat et léger de café, de malts rôtis accompagnés de la Signature de la Maison qui maîtrise les houblons à la perfection. Très complexe pour un stout ni impérial ni barriqué. Dès la première gorgée, je suis saisi par la douceur de ce liquide à la torréfaction remarquable. Un liquide presque lacté me coule en bouche dans un élan de délicatesse ponctué par une fine bulle des plus élégantes. Un somptueux café froid mêlé dun chocolat amer, dun houblon estival et léger. Cette bière est larchétype de lélégance.

Look; black beer, beige vanished top. 
Aroma; ice coffee, caramel, zebra candies, grassy hops. 
Taste; ice coffee black sort of, caramel, dark prune peels fermented through something - 
and finishes very well liquorice-pruned. 
Palate; good body, soft, good. 
Overall; tasty stuff indeed.

taste bitter coffee.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Victoriagade. Pitch black with a fluffy, tanned head. Roasted aroma with dark malts, chocolate, coffee, roasted, bitter notes. Toasted bread and red berries. Taste is bitter-roasted. Medium to full body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes dry and roasted with lingering dark, bitter chocolate and toasted notes. Lovely Stout.

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Aroma of roasted and burnt malt and coffee, vanilla, bitter chocolate. Black with tan head, mostly lasting. Taste is moderate malt bitter and light+ sweet. Full body, oily texture, avg. carb., long malt bitter finish.

Tap. Black body with a small beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffe, chocolate notes and a hint ofvanilla. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and with bitter notes. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice Stout indeed. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Taste is medium bitter and medium sweet. Medium bodied, thin texture, soft carbonation. Finish is roasted and coffee, pretty straightforward but a decent coffee stout.

A black full-bodied stout, with a rich coffee aroma and flavour, on top of caramel and roasted malt. Full taste, with balanced sweetness. Delicious and very drinkable.

Tap @ Mikkeller & Friends. Black with medium beige head. Nice retention and good lacing. Coffee, roasted malts, vanilla and toffee, accompanied by a hint of black berries, and a bit peated in the taste. Full body and oily texture, very soft carbonation.

Keg. Black with a medium sized light brown head. Roasted malt, vanilla, light chalk, chocolate, fudge. Medium/full body, oily texture, soft carbonation, some sweetness, pleasant long bitter finish. Nice.

(20 cl on tap @ Mikkeller Bar)
Poured at the usual too-cold fridge temperature into a Mikkeller signature glass reveals a mostly black body with one finger of toffee head that subsides after a while leaving little film but beautiful lace. Solid regeneration. Left to sit in the window sill for half an hour but still pretty cold during appreciation. Aroma is dominated by roasted malt with a notable absence of disharmonic notes and the roast itself being decidely augmented by the tangible yet not rough or unpleasant coffee notes. Coffee can take many forms in a beer and some of them make you think more of the coffee grounds. That is not the case for this beer where you get the best of the aroma notes from freshly roasted beans as far as I can tell. Its like the aeropress of stouts perhaps. Imbibing the brew reinforces the impression of a smooth, no-nonsense coffee stout. The mouthfeel is sufficiently oily to support the aroma and flavour yet not viscous in a bottom heavy sense. Oats have been dispensed competently of course. Is there sugar in this coffee? Well its certainly not harsh, ascerbic or rough but it would be a lie to say I could taste the sugar cube or that it got cloying in any way. This is a fine specimen for a coffee stout and it probably replaces Gammas La Cabra as my #1 contender for a breakfast beer in real life. It may not be as gratifying aromawise as the Maple Bacon but its certainly much more smooth, elegant and refined in the flavour and the mouthfeel.

Tap c4. Pours pitch black with a brown head. Aroma of coffee, sweet malts, huge coffee, hoppy, roast, light choko. Taste is quiet sweet, huge coffee, quite hoppy, roast, light choko. Very lingerin coffee.

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Very dark brown with medium beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, espresso, wood and hop. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, espresso, medium sweet, hop, caramel and medium bitter.
Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Nice head woth good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are rich coffee, roast malt, chocolate, hops and has a nice rich coffee fnish.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Aarhus. Pours black with a small brown head, lacings. Aroma of roasted malt, rich coffee, expresso, caramel. Flavor is rich malty, rich coffee, caramel, expresso, some dark chocolate. Medium body, soft ot average carbonation, dry light bitter finish. 070316
Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Black with a brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate, caramel and coffee. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and roasted moderate bitter finish. 070416
Pours pitch black with a nice brown head. Aroma is deep coffee chocolate roasted malts. Flavor is fruity crisp pungent astringent chocolate coffee bitter.

Sample at The Trillium and Tree House-tasting in Kville, Göteborg. Extra bottle. Opaque black beer with a nice lasting beige/brownish head. Roasted dark chocolate and coffee aroma, licorice, cocoa powder, soot, licorice, some tar. Roasted chocolate flavor, cocoa powder, coffee, espresso, soot and tar, well hidden alcohol. Full bodied, very well balanced coffee style stout.

Bondurants, NYC tap: pours black with a dark tan head. Aroma is chocolate, vanilla, coffee, hops, roasted malts, and hints of smoke. Taste is rather bitter for a stout, but not in the black IPA way. Very roasty. Hints of vanilla. Finish is nice and does not linger too long. Heavy on complexity and flavor. Quite nice.

Pours pitch black with a beige creamy head. Aromas of dark chocolate, dark coffee, dark fruits, liquorice, and caramel. Taste is coffee, dark fruits, chocolate, toffee and vanilla. I only wish it had a touch more carbonation, but otherwise a fine, soothing stout.

750mL growler filled 3/18/16 and drunk 3/25/16.Perfect pour as expected; massive tan head tops an ebony body with strong retention. Clarity undetermined.Rich and bready in the nose, with strong roast, vanilla and treacle suggestions. Very fudgey, especially with warming but the dry, cellar/plaster-like house yeast character helps allay some of this. The coffee is strong but not overbearing and pretty well integrated with the malt character. No alcohol or flaw noted.In the mouth its a bit more difficult to rate. The flavors are certainly rich and well-developed, with tons of chocolate fudge, espresso and vanilla. Coffee is not intensely bitter or heavily roasted and theres a fair amount of syrupy treacle-meets-marshmallow-meets-chocolate-toffee flavor. Carbonation is low though not particularly so for a stout. No alcohol or flaws with a very malty, somewhat syrupy texture. Though there is some amount of enjoyable ash/char, it could still use some more dryness and I dont think this is supposed to be a sweet stout, though it would work better as one of those. Nonetheless, quite drinkable and flawless in the flavor category.

Draught at Blind Tiger alehouse. 
Pours black with a tan head 
Smooth brew with roasted malts, chocolate And licorice

Pours black with a nougat creamy head. Aroma; cocoa, medium roasted coffee malt, dried dark fruits, liqourice, chocolate and caramel. Flavours; Loads of coffee, dried dark fruits, cocoa, liqourice and some vanilla

March 27, 2016. Bottle, courtesy of James, thanks! 
Black with a creamy medium sized brown head. Aroma is roasted ground coffee, dark berries, notes of cocoa, dried dsrk fruits, licorice.
Taste is light to medium sweet, very soft roasted bitterness. Finish is lots of roasted coffee, soft bitter, berry sweetness, notes of toffee, light cocoa. Medium to full bodied, very creamy, soft carbonation. 
Very creamy with lots of soft roasted coffee, great!

Bottle courtesy of Hackobock. Pours viscous black with a rather big creamy dark mocha head that leaves lots of spotty sticky trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is malty and roasty with roasted malts, caramel, burnt cookies, dark roast coffee, bitter chocolate, dried cherries, dried cranberries, sweet liquorice candy, moist soil and hints of alcohol. Taste is sweet, bitter, heavy malty, roasty and tiny fruity. Mouthfeel is fat, creamy, velvety, round, roasted astringent and near full bodied. Finish is tiny sweet, bitter and extremely rich in the roasty malts and fruity coffee. Lovely full bodied coffee treat.
A: Pitch black with a one finger brown/nougat coloured head. N: Coffee, grapes T: Coffee, espresso, milk chocolate O: Coffee coffee coffee! Very creamy mouth feeling!

500 ml bottle shared with friends at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki, from trade with Frank. Black color with beige brown head. Roasted malty aroma, coffee, cocoa, chocolate, light fruity, light caramel. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma, chocolate coffee and dark fruits. Full silky almost creamy body with soft carbonation. Great coffee stout!

Bottle at home. Ive tried a lot of coffee stouts, and I typically find that they falter in one of two places: either the coffee flavor is too faint, or the acidity is so high from the coffee and the dark malt that it tastes almost sour. This beer was completely different -- easily the best coffee stout Ive ever had. Rich, medium-full mouthfeel gives it a creamy texture, and the chocolate and coffee are both present and well-integrated. Fantastic.

Bottle, by way of trade with Leighton. Big thanks! Clear, dark, chestnut brown. Messy, sticky, bubbly, tan head. Viscous and leggy. Handsome beer. Nose has fresh ground coffee. Vanilla. Coffee ice cream. Chocolate ice cream. Sweet, wheaty malts. As it opens up theres a woody, unwashed coffee bean earthiness. Some final notes of grassy hop. Taste is earthy bitter. Plenty of cereal sweetness. Smooth, chocolatey soft mouthfeel. Really easy drinking. Finishes long, roast coffee bean bitter. Lingering sweetness on the lips. Packs it in big for only 7.2%. Delightful.

Bottle. Pours black with a mocha head that leaves behind some lacing as it dissipates to a ring around the glass. Aromas of chocolate, cocoa, and roasted malts most apparent after the pour. Slight alcohol after it has warmed. Light sweetness up front overtaken mid-palate by a moderate, slowly growing bitterness and dryness. Chocolate, cocoa. Full bodied, soft and fluffy mouthfeel. Quite dry finish.

Bottle from SlovakSniper (thanks!), shared with Parksy, phantomhennes, and TvM. We had this alongside Mikkeller Beer Geek Brunch Weasel, and this brew was the clear standout, sperior in balance, complexity, mouthfeel, and simple tastiness. by far the most elegant coffee beer Ive ever had.

text: Bottle dated 08/17/15, from the source. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma is dark chocolate, molasses, coffee. Flavor follows. Dark chocolate, oak, coffee. Nice and smooth.

Poured from bottle thanks Willrunforbeer black brown pour with a nice two finger tan head. Aromas of fresh coffee roasted malt and hint of oatmeal. A nice rich creamy mouth feel with notes of dark chocolate coffee and malt.

On tap at the Blackback. Black body. Viscous looking. Huge chocolate head. Settles to a small collar. Aroma of coffee and extremely roasty malt. Oatmeal is really strong. Smells like it could be too roasty. 

Taste taste is much improved. Coffee blends into the roasted malt. A little sweet. Oatmeal lends to the sweetness. Even a bit of burnt smokiness. 
Smooth and creamy, but it had a roasty bitterness. Medium carbonation. 
A little disconnected. Sweet and bitter, both in seemingly disproportionate quantities.

Amazing. A lot of roasted, toasted, coffee, dough, chocolate, a bit toffee aromas. Taste is medium bitter, lovely coffee , all very well balanced. 
Average carbo, quite creamy medium bodied and nice coffee finish.
Truely the best coffee stout i ever drank.

2015-09-23 En fût @ Hill Farmstead. Bière presque noir surmontée d'une mousse brune. Arômes de café et de malt torréfié avec une pointe d'avoine. En bouche, café et malt rôti enrobés de chocolat qui laisse place à un houblon résineux. En finale, une pointe de conifère et une amertume prononcée. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Black body, thin tan head, sparse lacing. Assertive roasted coffee, some oats, earthy bitterness, and some licorice. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, soft sweetness, and, despite the roasted qualities, finishes a bit muted.

500ml bottle. Black with a frothy tan head. Flavors are roasted cereals, coffee, oats, brown sugar, chocolate, cookie dough, vanilla, licorice and resinous hops with fruity notes. Medium body, soft carbonation, creamy texture.

Black with a light chocolate head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, roasted chestnuts. Full bodied, roasty and lightly bitter on the palate with a nutty finish. Taste is bitter coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malts.

Bottle at Mr Smiths HF-dominated wedding celebration. It pours jet black with a thick tan head. The nose is rich, decadent, big espresso coffee vibe, dark chocolate, rich roast, mild acidity and coffee cake. The taste is rich, yet smooth, deep roast coffee, mild acidity, dark chocolate torte, light vanilla, toasty dark bread and a touch of umami with a smooth, roasty finish. Medium body, moderate carbonation and velvety mouth-feel. Not crazy complex, yet flavoursome and extremely well-balanced. Excellent.

Bottle a few weeks old. Pours a thick black with a small tan head. Aroma of coffee and roast. Taste is semi dry and lightly bitter from the malts and coffee. Gently acidity. Mouthfeel is very full and silky. Very filling. Huge dose of coffee. This is a stout on steroids. Amazing.

bottle shared with and courtesy of Kermis. big thanks.
Thin creamy tan head. Clear black pour. Lots of coffee in the aftertaste. Nicely done

Bottle shared. Pours near black with a medium beige head. Aroma of oat, cacao, roasted malt, espresso, toffee, caramel and a little licorice. Flavor is moderate sweet and over moderate bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle from cpetrone-thanks, Chris! About 15 months on this, maybe a bit too long, but still drinking great. Dark black, medium high body, dark coffee crema colored foam on edges of the glass. Big dark roast coffee nose, light vanilla, dark roast malts. Very smooth, burnt malts, and quality dark coffee, with some vanilla like notes to balance it out.

New England Bucket List Trip #154. Growler from the brewery. Pours a dark brown with a large frothy dark brown head. Good head retention. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, mild oats. The taste is chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, mild nuts and dark fruit. Medium bodied, mild lingering roast, exceptional balance.

Fresh growler fill thanks to Kirk. Appearance is black with a thin layer of light mocha head. Aroma is oats, coffee roast, and dark chocolate. Taste is chocolate, followed by some light coffee roast, silky smooth mouthfeel, all perfectly balanced. This is outstanding, man, such great balance.
Growler from Hill Farmstead. Pours a dark brown to black with a brown head. Aroma of roasted coffee, light grain. Taste is sweet with a crisp finish. Medium thick mouthfeel.

Growler. Dark brown. Sticky but clean. Roasted malts with nutty elements and dark chocolate. Really awesome. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at HF. Poured black with thick tan head. Huge coffee aroma. Light carb med bod. Tastes bitter roasted coffee

Draft. Dark cola with a thick mocha head. Aroma is oat, chocolate and subtle coffee. Coffee becomes more apparent in the taste but the balance is incredible. Perfect tension between sweet and toasty. Medium smooth and sticky mouthfeel. Outstanding.
This is stout heaven. Creamy chocolate and coffee perfection. Beautiful aroma and smooth taste. Vermont knows how to do it right. Best beer, coffee, and food imaginable. Im in pure bliss.

Tap @ Hotel Vermont. Wow now this is what Im talking about. Im in stout heaven here with notes of coffee, chocolate, barley, and pure bliss. Slam dunk and wish there was a way I could high jack the keg to bring home.

Growler shared thanks to scotchzi! Pours an opaque black with fluffy tan head that leaves good lace. Aroma of deep roasted malts and coffee, hints of dark chocolate and smoke. Taste follows, nice and smooth, good balance of roast and smoke. Nothing crazy, but nicely done.

Bottle thanks to Aaron and Erik. Pours a pitch black with a fluffy, brown head. Aroma has coffee, cocoa, licorice and salmiak, hints of oatmeal and some slight roast. Taste is bitter roasty with lots of coffee, but also some fruity sweetness. Smooth and nice, and with a little hop presence as well. Low carb.

On tap at Hill Farmstead. Poured a dark brown, near black, dark brown head that recedes into a nice cap. Aromas of coffee, bitter bakers chocolate, anise and a light toast. Taste is nicely balanced, just as the nose. Slight bitter chocolate and coffee lends to a nice sweet cereal malt and yeast harmony. Finishes with a medium bodied mouthfeel and a nice crisp bitter coffee that lingers for a minute. Tasty!

beige dense head fades with foamhead leaves structured lacing. coffee coloured. aroma is liquorice, oats, coffee, earthy and bit salty. taste like aroma, bitter chocolate with a long lasting bitter aftertaste. quite dense body, medium carbonation. bottle 50cl / bd dec-2013

From notes. This was shared at a tasting put on by @mikem409 on November 7. The pour on this thing is a nice oily black with a medium tan head and some gorgeous lace. The aroma is heavy in coffee. There is a bit of roasted malt, good cocoa notes, a strong dark fruit presence (prune or cherry) and a light smokey vanilla on the far back. The flavor is just as great. There is a ton of coffee but the rest of the flavors break through as it moves through the mouth. The mouth feel is creamy and viscous with a good medium carbonation that helps it coat really well. The aftertaste is definitely roasty and dry with some good cocoa and coffee Lightly bitter. Love it!
Bottle at weekly share thanks to Phil. Pours black tan head. Nose/taste of flaked oats, roast chocolate, vanilla and coffee. Well balanced. Medium body.

Thanks to Erik for sharing! Pours black with a brown head. Aroma of fresh coffee beans, cocoa beans, roasted malts, weak raw vanilla and some weak sweet liquorice. Delicate! Taste is just very delicate, clean and good! Lots of chocolate, coffee, raw vanilla, cocoa, gentle hops and with a delicate and nice mouthfeel. Like all HF beers - this is so well made!

Bottle split 5 ways. Pitch black pour with a nice dense brownish head. Nose is very forward with freshly ground coffee and roast. Taste also is dominated by freshly ground coffee, some vanilla and chocolate in there as well. Nice and simple!

Bottle. Thanks Bursprak. Pours pitch black with a creamy medium brown head. Aromas of fruity coffee, slight vanilla, some bitter chocolate, Taste is coffee up front, salmiak licorice, figs, dates, vanilla, bitter chocolate.

Bottle: Thanks, Michael. Oily, dark black pour with a huge, chunky, foamy, deep tan head that builds up thick, lasts for a while, & leaves a few nice sheets of wet lacing on its way down the glass. Aroma is full force roasted & oily coffee beans. Not quite charred like French roast, more like a Full City roast. Underside of bitter cocoa nibs, faint vanilla, & deeply driven dried black cherries. Back end has a small twinge of roasted smokiness, much like Everett has throughout. Taste is a coffee bomb as well... Loaded with a light bitterness & roasted element, however gracefully balanced by a touch of milky malt sweetness, hints of dark chocolate, & anise. The finish ends with a kiss of roast, faint smoke, & only last nibble of rich coffee beans. Somewhat creamy body. Lovely beer for coffee drinkers, just great.

Courtesy of tectactoe
Bottle: The aroma consists of heavy dark chocolate, black licorice, anise, molasses, espresso /coffee, and very faint vanilla. It pours a dark brown with no transparency and a small brown head that quickly fades to a thin ring around the edges. The flavor starts with moderate dark chocolate and a hint of vanilla. The finish has moderate-heavy coffee and light-moderate black licorice. Its medium bodied with light-moderate carbonation.
Bottle pours black with tan with frothy tan head. Aroma of nuts and coffee. Finish is bitter with coco and oatmeal

On tap @ the Jeffrey NYC. Pours a deep dark brown, soft and creamy beige head. Aroma is fresh espresso, coffee, caramel, cocoa, bourbon, light campfire. Flavor is jam packed with roasted malt, smoked cedar, bourbon, light licorice and burnt coffee, bitter hoppy chocolate finish. Light bourbon booze on the finish, as well as dry chocolate hop. This stuff is pretty ridonk... Really dig the balance and hop character pushing through.

Bottle from Luk_, thanks! Pours a complete black with a medium brown head that fades into a rim that leaves some lacing. Nose is of roasted coffee, nuts and chocolate. Taste is of same coffee beans (with the slightlest green pepper angle) and roasted malt. It is not an ounce to sweet, really nice. Body is medium-full and carbonation medium, making the mouthfeel so smooooth. Overall a really nice coffee stout that for whatever reason I had never rated. This is my first time with a bottle but it seemed a little different from the tap version I had last time, a little less green pepper maybe? Anyway, really good.
Typical Hill Farmstead, Shaun has some sort of otherworldly touch and everything he does it really on point. As far as flavor it's coffee with a nice balanced bitter finish. Worth seeking out

Draft at Rye House, huzzah. Pours near black with small mocha head. Aroma is fantastic cold brew, bitter chocolate, burnt toffee, prunes, oak, berries, whisky. Taste is silky dark chocolate fading into coffee milkshake and caramel with a prominent drying hop bitterness and lingering finish. Think Everett plus caramel cold brew. Medium light mouthfeel. Out of control.

Draft at ginger man for lunch. Pours deep brown with nose of chocolate and licorice. Tastes of espresso, dark chocolate, licorice, roasted malts, and some plum. Just right amounts of sweet chocolate and bitter hops. Really lovely stout.

Draft at Gingerman (thanks for the heads up, Jow). Pours a rich jet black body with thin brown lacing. Aroma is rich, luscious chocolate, mild to sweet coffee roast and faint hop profile. Mouthfeel is medium to full with a nice prickly carbonated feel towards to the end; the dark chocolate character dominates over the sweet roast, with a subtle fresh hop flavor lingering towards the end. Great superbly balanced stout. If it wasnt lunch, Id take down a few of these.

750 swingtop. Not sure when filled, added to HF lineup recently, still available. Tried the day after initially opened. Lots of built up carbonation when opened. Taste and aroma was lots of dark bitterness from malt and coffee. Roast and coffee. Body was slightly flat but assuming that it was because of the prior opening. ACTH more carbonation than when I had fresh Everett on the second day of a 2L. Overall its pretty good stuff. Definitely seem to enjoy the dark HF beers much more fresh than aged or barrel aged.

Aroma: Oatmeal, Coffee, Mildly Bitter

Appearance: Dark Opaque Hue, Passes No Light, Brown Head Ring, Mild Lacing

Taste: Oatmeal, Coffee, Mild Coffee

Mouthfeel: Average Carbonation, Medium to Full Bodied, Mildly Drying

On tap at the brewery and later at Parker Pie. Dark brown pour light brown head. Coffee and dark roasted malt bouquet. Dark roasted malts, coffee, bakers chocolate, and muted caramel notes. Very good body and mouthfeel.
Bottle. Very dark maroon brown color, brown head. Nice aroma of deep, rich chocolate and coffee. Taste is dark licorice, burnt espresso. Delicious.

Draft. Cocoa aroma over mild carbonation. Thick and chewy. A bit sweet with nice head. Solid oatmeal stout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2016 Dark brown pour, But a thumbs worth of head. Huge roast and oat aroma. Taste of fresh roasted coffee beans, oat, roasted malt, grains, dark bakers chocolate. Fuller body, amazing mouthfeel

Served alongside Earl (bourbon).
The beer is dark brown, near black, with a half inch of beige cap. The aroma brings roast, coffee, oats. Definitely smells true to style. A delicious beer. Oatmeal, chocolate cereal grains. On par with Samuel Smith and Youngs (is that sacrilege? - if so, favoring whom?). A solid beer.
Tasty stuff, a good integration of coffee. Black bodied. Above average mouthfeel. Good drinkability.

500 ml bottle shared by Huhzubendah, thanks Matt! Pours an oily jet black with ruby red hues when backlit. A thin layer of bubbles line the edge of the meniscus. Aroma is dark bitter chocolate, malt, roast, coffee and cacao. Flavor is same with lactic silky mouthfeel, roasted malt, moderate carbonation and bitter coffee and dry tar finish. Delicious. Only 7.2%?? Flavor is bursting out of this beer for such a low ABV.
Bottle thanks to Matt. Pours a dark brown with light beige head. The aroma is roast, dark chocolate, oatmeal, nuts. Thick mouthfeel with nice roast and sweet raisin and oatmeal. Very good.

Black pour with a full beautiful dark brown head. The aroma is intoxicating. Amazing notes of dark, roasted malt, cocoa, and loads of espresso. Some light soy, some smoke, and burnt brown sugar. The body is silky and luscious, the carb is soft and luxurious. The finish is medium bitter, loads of bitter espresso. Sweet and bitter cocoa, and touches of warming alcohol. Incredible stout. World class.

Bottle - thanks Reynolds214! Pours opaque black with a medium creamy brown head, great lacing. Aroma is roasty, dark roasted malts, cocoa. Flavor is light sweet, medium bitter, roasty, burned, Ashes. Medium body, super creamy, light acidity.

Rating #600! Shared with Trish. 500ml bottle (2014 release) pours dark rich brown with a small finger of tan head. Nose is bursting with rich roasty earthy coffee, chocolate, mocha. Taste is super smooth silky coffee, cream, cocoa, coffee bean. Finish is more of the deliciousness, rich bitter roasty mocha, coffee, a little sweet dark chocolate. So good.

Bouteille partagée. Bière brune presque noire avec une mousse brune. Un premier nez diode, de grain rôti. Une bouche à la texture crémeuse. Les saveurs sont intenses de tabac. La finale est très amère et piquante.

Earl a été embouteillé en décembre 2013. Ce stout est presque noir et sa mousse brune accepte dêtre généreuse avec lil du valeureux dégustateur. Au nez, cette bière bien torréfiée révèle de lavoine, du charbon de bois et des malts rôtis bien enroulés de chocolat noir et presque pur. En bouche, mes papilles qui sont lourdement rôties notent des pointes de houblons américains qui sont plus près du conifère et de la terre que des agrumes. Au palais, le liquide montre un corps proprement normal avec un pétillement modéré à élevé et une texture finement huileuse. En finale, lamertume est assez intense : la rencontre entre les malts brûlés, le tabac et les houblons encore bien vigoureux ébranle mes capteurs sensoriels. Larrière-goût un peu brutal ralenti quelque peu la buvabilité. Tout de même un produit bien intéressant.
Bottle pour. Pours a thick brown to black with a khaki colored head. Aroma has rich, intense coffee and roasty bitterness in the taste. Thicker mouthfeel with low to medium carbonation.
Bottle. Black pour with brown head. Light roasted malt, and hints of coffee aromas. Flavor of coffee, oats and malt tones.

Pours black, two finger silky tan head

Smell big fruity, nutty coffee roast, bit creamy, bit oily, dark coco

Taste creamy coffee and grainy, light roasty chocolate finish

Light body

Solid. Not mind blowing
nice to finally be able to try something from Hill Farmstead, and this one is pretty solid for the style.

Pours black with a thick mocha head...nice lacing. Aroma has nice smoky espresso notes, faint dark fruit, and mild bakers chocolate. Flavor steps up the roasty espresso...light smoky notes, bitter roast and dark chocolate. Mouthfeel is medium and the finisn is chocolatey leading into lingering coffee/roasty bitterness. Well made with a near perfect amount of coffee throughout.

Pour is black with a tight mocha head. Nose is smooth roasted coffee, hint of burnt toffee, with a light vanilla aroma. Taste is more roasty and burnt than the nose, lots of coffee and gets a hint acrid and bitter. Some chocolate malts cling to the back sides of the mouth with notes of vanilla. Body is incredibly soft and creamy with extremely gentle carbonation. Really opens as it warms bringing out more malt depth and richness balancing well with coffee and helping reduce the bitterness.

Bottle 500ml.
Pours black with low light brown head. Nice lacing. Aroma is of coffee, roasted malt, sugar, chocolate, resin. Taste is of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, slight bitterness, slight alcohol. Palate: Medium-full bodied. Good balance. Overall: Very tasty. Good.

Bottle (500 ml). Thanks to Frank for this one! Black with a medium thick, creamy, fully lasting beige head and good lacing. Aroma is mostly of chocolate and coffee along citrus notes and fruits. Taste is slightly sweet and mostly of chocolate and roasted malt. Theres also light citrus and vanilla notes. Medium to full body (but not heavy). Moderate carbonation. Creamy/silky mouthfeel. Very nice balance. Well constructed Stout. Tasty.
50cl bottle pours an oily black with some thin, beige head. Nose of malt, toast, coffee, molasses. Flavor is solid, malty, coffee, molasses, raisin, toast. Full bodied, roasty finish.

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2014 Bonne stout aux arômes de torréfaction, céréales et chocolat. Je mattendais a être plus émerveillé vu lorigine du produit, mais cétait une bonne stout réconfortante sans plus de magie. Tout de même parmi les meilleures que jai bu!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours black with a nice tan head, aroma is great coffee roast aroma, taste is well balanced stout

Bottle. Pours opaque black with a medium, creamy tan head, short retention with light lacing. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, and nutty malt, spicy alcohol, prunes, raisins, dates, earthy and spicy hops. Flavor is dark malt and fruits, spicy alcohol, and smoke with a dry finish. Full body and medium carbonation.
Bouteille 500mL. Brune foncée générant peu de mousse. Nez de grains torréfiés et de café. Bouche soyeuse: grains torréfiés, moka, café. Excellente.

500ml bottle thanks to Onebigtymer11. Pours black with a creamy dark mocha head. Aroma of dark chocolate, rich coffee, vanilla, and char. More chocolate comes through as it warms. Taste of burnt toast, dark chocolate, espresso grounds, and a hint of vanilla in the aftertaste. Good stuff!
(500ml bottle) espresso brown, tan bubbles. Nose of black coffee grounds, cream, licorice and tree bark. Taste of ash, burnt toast, tree bark, licorice, anise. Medium to thin body. Sweetish finish.
Pours a dark brown with a burnt tan lacing. The aroma consists heavily of coffee and chocolate. Moderate sweetness. Incredible.

A: dark brown with a tan head
S: chocolate, vanilla, roasted nuts
T: Chocolate, dark coffee, dark malts
M: thin, slick, oily, light carbonation 
O: a great coffee oatmeal stout

500 ml bottle brand new dated 12 - 2013. All kinds of spotty lace down the side the snifter. Nose is pure roasted coffee and chocolate malts. Flavor is chocolate and roasted malts to include Bitter coffee bean and oats in the body which gives it a much improved body. Slightly creamy texture and an oily mouthfeel. Extremely drinkable and you will like this if you enjoy coffee stouts. For me Im left wanting a bit more.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2014 Une magnifique stout dotée dune torréfaction puissante mais qui ne séternise pas en amertume indélébile. Le corps est duveteux et riche pour sa grosseur et les notes de moka finissent par percer à mesure que le liquide se réchauffe. Impressionnante charge de saveurs pour 7.2%.

On tap at Prohibition Pig: aroma is perfect, lots of coffee and roasted goodness. Flavor is a lot of coffee, roasted malts, a bit earthy, and some hops. Full bodied, a bit sticky, leaves a slight sweet flavor. Awesome coffee stout.
On tap at Three Penny. Jet black pour with a one finger mocha head. Smell is straight coffee and roast. Taste is dark roast coffee, cocoa, and sweet malt. Slightly sticky finish. Awesome.

750 ml bottle shared with the group. Pours a dark brown color with a medium sized cola like beige head. The aroma and flavor have roasted malt, oatmeal sweetness, mild coffee notes, green earthy hops, smooth, medium body, great flavor.

Verre dun fût, au 3e anniversaire de Hill Farmstead. Arômes intenses de café froid et de torréfaction. Robe noire et opaque, légère dentelle moka et effervescence délicate. En bouche, le café est très intense, mais parfaitement soutenu par des malts torréfiés complexes et moelleux. Très belle texture onctueuse, sans que la bière ne paraisse trop sucrée. Finale moyennement amère de houblon résineux. Une excellente stout au café.
growler grabbin! .. . pours a deep black liquid .. . good coco head, nice lacing .. . tar, ash, and charcoal .. . medium mouth .. . a solid stout .. . canoe is actually spelled canoo

Pour from a 750 ml growler gave a dark black hued brew with a great looking mocha head. Smells of roasted chocolate malt. Medium in body and smooth. Coffee flavors mix well with the malt character without alot sweetness. The Guatemalan coffee character is good but not my favorite coffee variety but OK.  Overall a very good beer.

Near black, small cocao-colored head. Roasted coffee bean, bitter chocolate, toasted malt, a lot of smoke, oak and cedar wood, perhaps a hint of vanilla. A little too much carbonation, but smooth and creamy all the same. In between medium and full bodied, bitter finish. Alcohol is low and not very apparent.

A bit too much smoke in my opinion; Earl reminds me of the smoked stouts and porters I had when exploring that style

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2013 750 flip-top at home with friends. Thanks Adam!! Pour is pitch black with a creamy brown head and great lacing. Big chocolate, coffee, vanilla, roast, a touch of grass, some toffee, and wood in the aroma. Taste is super smooth and creamy, roasted malt, dark chocolate, vanilla, big espresso, grass, and oak with a lightly roasted/bitter finish. Creamy mouthfeel with low carbonation. Awesome stout, I could chug this stuff.

Growler @ Stephens house courtesy of Steve_0. Big thanks! Pours a black appearance with a dark brown head. Moderately roasty, dark chocolate, oaty, light coffee aroma. Burnt chocolate, mild anise, coffee, light vanilla, moderately bitter hoppy flavor. Pretty tasty.

Pour out of 750 mL growler, big thanks Stephen! Thick black pour with creamy tan head, aroma brought notes of coffee, roast, dark chocolate, hints of toffee, nice earth, grain and spice notes, coffee ground notes with some vanilla.  Taste is a mix of vanilla, coffee, roast, nice chocolate, bakers chocolate, coffee bean, espresso, hints of earth, spice, finishing fairly sweet, bit nice and roasted and bitter.  Nice.
Draft from el diamante. Deep dark pour with sticky filmy tan head. Espresso aroma. Malty coffeeroast  taste. Bitter chocolate finish. Quite good

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2014 Sampled at the brewery.  Pours black. Aroma of coffee and roasted malts plus floral hops.  Flavor the same.  Smooth texture.  A great stout.  Edit: 500ml bottle and sampled again at the brewery.  Pours black with a tan head.  Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, some light cereal, and a touch of hops.  Smooth texture.  Still a great coffee stout.

Growler. Big whiff of coffee in the nose, roasty as hell, oats & caramely roast on the palate. Not super complex; just beautifully blended. Approaching best-of-style. Jesus, Shaun & crew did it again.
draft at Lord hobo, black thicker pour, thing of beauty. big roasted maltiness, coffee and chocolate notes in both aroma & flavor. another great beer from HF

Pours a rich deep umber black color with a finger of mocha foam. The nose is gritty earthy coffee, chocolate and some nice roasty malts and some traces of dark fruit... the palate follows the nose nicely with a good dose of carbonation to really lighten up the rich velvety mouthfeel. Nice lingering chocolate with a hint of oat coming through... dry finish.
Tap at worthy burger. Bunch of clean bright fresh roast.  Dark chocolate. Dry tasty.  Clean.   Touch of cream.   Deep luscious bitter roast and truffle on the finish.  Real nice.

On tap at Prohibition Pig.  One of the nicest looking beers Ive come across.  Pours a viscous black with thick brown head and great head retention.  Aroma is coffee, light roasted maltyness, chocolate, and spuce/citrus hoppyness.  Flavor is lightly sweet and creamy with nice coffee flavors and pretty assertive hop flavors.  Awesome brew.
On tap straight at the source, delicious coffee flavors, thick foamy dark body and head, this is crushing t

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2014 Review from notes. Thanks Wally! Gorgeous pour, dense black with hints of sediment, nice frothy head. Nose was pretty great. Very smoky and still some coffee left over. Taste was decent but its not what it used to be as far as fresh flavors. No hop bitterness left, lots of coffee, some creamy mouth feel. Heavy bold body. 

Updated 2013 Batch enjoyed at home on the day I bought it
Nice dark brown to black. 2 finger decent creamy brown head
Loaded with huge bursting coffee. bursting with chocolate as well. 
Nice. very mellow, drinkable and not overpowering. Nice bitterness. roasted walnuts, chocolate and crisp minerally water. bottle conditioning is great. yeah nice beer but not pushing any limits

Bottle shared in NH, many thanks to the generous Wallace. Pours rich brown with a large, beige cream head. Nose of strong roasted malts, heavy bourbon, burnt wood. Bold flavor, hefty roast and charred wood, bitter chocolate, some woody dryness. Full bodied with fine carbonation. Hot finish with pronounced bourbon character, wood, dark and bitter chocolate, rich dark bread, lasting roast. Awesome stuff.
8% abv. Thanks to Wally for the share! Smells of booze, liquorice, coconut grease, bitter chocolate and brandy alcohols. Tastes of booze, dark chocolate, fried plums, hops and earthiness

From notes, served in a HF wine glass.

Clear, very dark brown color with a light, bubbly tan head. Excellent retention and thick lacing. Earthy and roast coffee aroma, with surprising amount of hops and some faint chocolate notes. Flavor is typical of an oatmeal stout, creamy and smooth, with a silky body, and a strong chocolate and malt body throughout. Minimal bitterness, but strong fresh coffee flavor throughout. Much more robust and enjoyable experience than the BA version of Earl.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2016 On tap at Capones. Pitch black pour, small head and medium lacing. Verry peppery, jolly pump tasting, oaky brett, cocoa powders, some stone fruit at the close. Great roasty beer that still managed to keep the fruit flavors alive. Cheers. New batch from 8/15 Smell is cocoa fudge and bittersweet coffee with lots of complexity. Moved it up a notch.

Served on-tap at Capones into a sampler glass.

A - Pours jet black with a light one finger head, dissipating to small patches of head, leaving little to no lacing down the glass.

S - Lots of dark flavors in this one. Coffee, milk chocolate, and plenty of dark malt blend well. Some oatmeal and a bit of caramel sweetness creeps in as it begins to come to room temp. Good balance but nothing mind blowing.

T - A bit thin on entry. Quite a bit of dark smokiness up front giving way quickly to a mix of dark roasted coffee and chocolatey sweetness. Oatmeal adds a bit of chewiness and seems to help bring the body back up a bit. Finish is a huge blast of dark roast that lingers for some time. I liked how balanced all the flavors where.

M - Heavy body and flavor with moderate carbonation. The feel is neither thin nor overly creamy, good balance again. Finish is a bit too roasty for my liking.

D - Pretty high. I wish more brewery could brew a well balanced stout like this one. I liked it quite a bit but it was just good not great. I would definitely drink it again.
Big coffee and cream aroma which carries through nicely to the flavor.  I did not find it light on the palate at all.  Yet another masterpiece from Mr. Hill.

Bottle... Poured dark, near pitch black with a thin, light tan head.  Nice, full body.  Dark molasses, coffee, and mocha chocolate with some anise spice, roasted and charred malts, and mild hop earthiness.

Bottle shared by alexsdad06. Poured dark brown color with medium creamy tan head that lasted with excellent lacing. Aroma is very complex with roasted choclolate and hop. Full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Moderate to heavy chocolate bittersweet flavor and moderate to heavy complex dark sweet finish of long duration. Standout complex beer that went well with a cigar at the Bengal game.

growler. inky black with a small dark beige head, enough retention and lacing. strong coffee aromas and tons of bitter chocolate. taste is loads of roasted malts, semi-sweet chocolate, leather, smoke, licorice, backed with resinous bitter hops. full body, fizzy palate. excellent!
(Draught)  Pours a black body with a medium beige head.  Aroma of grapefruit, roasted malt, caramel, and chocolate.  Flavor of roasted malt, citrus, chocolate, and coffee with a dry, bitter finish.

growler... dark brown with a thin tan head... smells pretty creamy, milky with a bit of roast... my hopes were so high after having everett so Im tad disappointed, the body is way to thin almost distracting, charred watery with bit of chocolate

Growler split with mcberko. Pours a solid black with a small tan head. Aroma of espresso beans, dark chocolate, roasted malts. Flavour of intense coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malts, light smoke, wood. Leaves a light warming sensation in the chest. Full bodied, lovely and roasted, but seems a little thin in comparison to other stouts I have had. Still very enjoyable regardless.

750mL growler, sent from Glouglouburp (thanks Dany!), split many ways, pours black with a small tan head. Roasted aroma with lots of espresso - rich roasted qualities dominate. Flavour of very rich roasted malts, perfect balance between chocolate and espresso, with a chocolate and roasted finish. Great depth and body. Excellent.

750 ml growler picked up at the brewery. Pours a black brown color with a soapy tan head that falls quickly. smell is roasty coffee with some chocolate and carmel. taste is roasty malt/ coffee with some chocolate ending with carmel and a smooth hop bitterness. mouthfeel is smooth and rich. no alcohol to taste or feel. medium body. overall very enjoyable i would drink this again.

Chocolate colored pour; rich, savory aroma of dark fruits and warm spices, strongly suggestive of the coffee and in the best way.  Flavor is light, creamy and airy; nougat, cream, coffee, and an oddly perfect touch of citrusy hops.  Lightly dry and a mite too thin texturally; finishes dry and bitter.  Solid stuff.

Drank on tap (12 oz) at Three Penny Taproom in Montpelier, Vermont, on July 29, 2011. Black, no head. Aroma of barley and oats very malty, with notes of sweet coffee. Bitter coffee taste, barley very malty, good caffeinated bitterness. Its just one of their beers, but I understand why they are so appreciated!
Pours black with no head.  Aroma of coffee and roasted malt.  Lots of coffee flavor with roasted malt, dark chocolate, and some hops.  Just exceptional.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2014 Draft, 2011 RBSG bus tour.  Brown-black body, small off-white head.  Aroma is medium sweet, roast, grapefruit, some floral/orange.  Taste is moderately sweet, roast, grapefruit/orange.  Medium body, light acidity. (7/3/7/3/14)

12/6/14, bottle.  Small brown head atop brown-black body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, coffee, milk chocolate, some roast.  Taste is moderately sweet, milk chocolate, some roast, caramel, light earthy, grapefruit.  Sticky medium body.  (7/3/7/3/14)

On tap at the Hill Farmstead First Anniversary Party. Served in a Hill Farmstead long-stem tulip.

Pours a very, very dark brown color with a good off-white head and some really nice lacing on the way down. The nose brings forward some really nice coffee along with some roast and earthy characteristics. A bit of chocolate in the background as well as some hops. The flavor has nice coffee character along with some roast. Chocolate throughout. Mouthfeel is really excellent and the oats come through. No noticeable booze. Really a fantastic stout.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 06-16-2011
on tap @Capones Pre-RBSG-pours a tight/rich liht brown head and black color.  Aroma is pine/resin.  Taste is pine/resin hops with some bite, roasty dark malt-chocolate/some ash.

This poured a very dark brown color with a great tan head. Aroma was of light smokey coffee, very roasted malt almost burnt, and some dark chocolate too. Flavor was very smooth dark roasted coffee with light dark chocolate and some decent citrusy bittering hops. Great.
Draft at HF 1st Anniversary - Dark, thick, plenty of hops and yummy!  Well worth sampling again... and again.

dark brown, oily heavy white lacing. Roast and light cardboard nose, bit hot, milky chocolate qualities but also bitter. Flavor is oily, heavy roast, light chocolate, more grapefruit with a creamy texture, nice contrast between citrus and roast, though finish a bit empty.
tap at capones.  Very dark brown with small tan head.  Nose is fairly roasty, some coffee, a pronounced hop presence.  Flavor is coffee, roast, cocoa, hops.  Solid.
Pours near black with a beige head. Roasted malty aroma with coffee and espresso. The flavor has coffee, roasted malts, espresso, and a hint of smoke. Smooth and balanced.
Black pour with tan head and lace. Funk of roasty chocolate malt. Sweet floral with a light chocolate flavor. Good carbonation but a tad thin. Nice beer.

Tap at Capones for RBSG 2011. Pour is a blackish ruby with a large tan head leaving excellent lace. Nose is salted dried meat and tobacco. Taste is salty (no olives thankfully) with mild smoke, sharp and full earthy rye, mild nutty bitterness, hoppy to the point of verging on Black IPA. Very nice though. Its so nice to have a beer made with coffee that doesnt taste like coffee. Very good.

Milk chocolate and roast nose with a touch of dark fruit and piney hops. The taste is light to moderately sweet, moderately bitter, with dark chocolate, some molasses, citrus hops and prunes. Really nice stout, could use a but of work before being compared to kzoo though.

On tap @ HF anniversary. Nice black pour with a veil of cream foam. Aroma of roasted grain, coffee, chocolate and fresh hops. Taste is rich coffee flavour, with a good not too bitter finish. You can feel the richness of oats but it is still so quaffable for a stout, very well done brew.

On tap at Hill Farmsteads first anniversary celebration. Black pour with a tan froth. The flavor and aroma demonstrated epic roasty characteristics with coffee, chocolate, and oat coming through as well. Thick rich palate with a sweet roasty finish.

Growler sample via and shared with oakbluff. Jet black in colour with medium carbonation. Aromas are of high quality fresh brewed coffee, backed by milk chocolate and a touch of vanilla. Coffee plays the largest role in the mouth as well, but the secondary notes come through a bit stronger here. Oatmeal, faint caramelm roasted barley, and a bit of matchbox all play a role here. Medium to light bodied, with great bite from the roast and a very subtle tartness coming from somewhere. Another home run from Hill Farmstead.

Growler from Glouglouburp- thanks again Dany!  Pours opaque cola with frothy two finger head.  Huge delicious coffee nose, slight chocolate, but mostly just unbelievable coffee.  Taste- a juicy tart twang from the oatmeal, slight bitterness, and tons of fresh roasted coffee . Fantastic. Drinkability is off the charts.  Very light bodied but yet the flavour profile is amazing and the freshness of the coffee really shiines through.  HF really nailed this

Growler filled at the brewery.  Pours black with a small rim of light tan head.  Aroma of rich sweet roasted malt and a hint of coffee, graham cracker, and chocolate malt.  Flavor of coffee and charred/burnt malt upfront with a roasty malt finish, light bitter coffee grounds, and bitter chocolate.  The coffee presence in this one is not super bold, just melds well with the stout base of the beer.  Very enjoyable.
7/4/8/4/15 [3.8/5]

Sampled from the tap at the brewpub. Poured black with a brown head that lasted throughout the beer. Aroma was full of strong bitter coffee with some dark grains that helped quell the bite of the coffee. Flavor was full of coffee as well with a nice creamy dark bread backing that balanced the beer nicely.
Nice balanced stout. Complex aromas and flavours, coffee notes present but not overwhelming.

Had twice now and it is just awesome. Just nice and smooth, well balanced. Great level of roasted malts, smooth body. A touch of vanilla and sweetness with a surprising hop balance. Nothing overly bitter either. Adds to the rich coffee that also has that light bitter roasted flavor. Well done!

De barril. Pitch black colour, nice brown head, steady and creamy like. Cooffe roasty malty pleasant aroma. Good filling mouthfeel. Roasted malt and chocolate in the flavour, good bitterness, sweet. Nice.

THIS BEER IS STUPID GOOD.   Pours a black body with a tan roast y head.  A bitter roasted malt chocolate body.  A hint of a vanilla sweetness to balance but never sweet.  Just a really solid drinking stout.  3 pints later i forgot about my 6 hour drive.  Nice to see a brewer that can make an awesome ipa, saison, & stout.  Seriously underated.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Viktoriagade 8BC, kld., DK-1655 Copenhagen, Denmark.Clear dark black brown color with a large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, fully to mostly lasting, beige head. Aroma is heavy malty, roasted, caramel, chocolate, chocolate malt, De Molen malt, dark malt. Flavor is heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration. Body is medium full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20110218]

Nose is barley, coffee, roasted malt, later leather and wood, feel is mediumbroad, carb is medium, taste is sweet coffee, burnt malt, later weak salty and bitter hoppy notes

On tap. Black and opaque with a light brown head. Distinct coffee aroma in fine balance with the hard roasted malts. Medium-bodied, sweetish hard roasted malts and vanilla - some coffee notes yes but not as pronounced as in the nose. Light malt bitterness. Well crafted. 190211

pitch black smooth light yellow head.
aroma is slightly fruity, roasted stuff, licorice, faint coffee.
flavor is coffee, licorice, roasted stuff, faint honey or flowery note (hops?)

Draught at MikkellerBAR. Pitch black - brown head. Nice hoppy. Carcoal. Nice smokey. Burned malts. Citrus. Grassy. Bitterness. Light flowery. Chocolate. Licorice. Smooth body with a good hop-bite. Dry finish. Very nice.

Draught at Mikkeller Bat.
Black coloured with a small beige ehad.
Roasted aroma of caramel, coffee and dark chocolate with notes of liquorice.
Roasted flavour of coffee and dark chocolate with notes of freshgrinded ccoffee.
Roasted finish.

From tap at MikkellerBar, courtesy of joergen. Pours dark brown to black  with a rocky, dense and chocolate brown head. Aroma is dark roasted malt, liqourice, tarish and dark chocolate. Bitter and solid roasted malty. Marmelade fruity, thick dark malty, bitter, hardroasted, chocolate and vague tarish note mixed with a light sweetness. Lingering bitter, dark roasted and slight fruity.

Draft. A black beer with a lazing dark brown head. The aroma has strong notes of roasted malt, and soy sauce, as well as medium notes of alcohol. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt almost burnt,as welll as notes of chocolate,  wood, and alcohol, leading to dry roasteed finish.

On draft at Capones.  Pours a pitch black with a small foamy light brown head.  Aroma of light roasted malt, oats, faint coffee beans and dry dark chocolate.  Taste of roasted malt, chocolate, oats and coffee.  Has a bittery aftertaste.

On tap on at Capones, this stout pours dark with a small head. The aroma is delicious - heavy caramel and toffee notes with light chocolate notes - right in my wheelhouse. The flavor is moderately sweet with some light bitterness from the malts and hops combined nicely for the style. The body was smooth, not too creamy or bubbly.
On tap at Capones. Roast, coffee, slightly bitter. Seemed rather weak and watery to me, but it may have been that I didnt let it warm up enough.

Sampled on draft at Capones.

Pours pitch black and comletely opaque without even the slightest trace of lifhtercolor when held to a light source and a one finger mocha colored head that slowly disappears leaving sporadic spots of lacing behind.

Slightly roasted coffee bean aroma with silky chocolate malt, oatmeal, toffee and hazelnut. Its very refreshing to encounter a coffee stut that doesnt smell like a burnt coffee bomb. Im even picking up some slight citrus and earhy hops. Im excited to drink this one.

Chewy full body with a great balance of roasted coffee bean, silky, luscious dark chocolate, oatmeal, toffee and bitter hops. Slight lactic character adds creaminess and fullness to the body and greatly increases the drinkabilitu. Im actually surprised how well balanced this is. I was expected it to be more acrid and bitter even though the aroma didnt suggest that. Slight citrus and earthy pine hops add complexity. This is a very well crafted, extremely quaffable coffee beer. Not very extreme but damn good.

On tap at Capones.  Dark brown with a trace of tan foam.  Nose is coffee, oats and molasses.  Not quite medium body with a tang.  Taste is coffee bean and chocolate; slightly bitter.  Very solid stout that disappeared from my glass way too quickly.

Draft at Capones (PA) 5 oz glass... Black in color.. Good aroma, chocolate, little smoke and roasted malts.  Nice simple stout. Lots of roasted malts, chocolate, a little smoke in the taste? Medium, creamy body. Overall: Nice stout!

Draught at Capones:  Aroma of roasted malt, roasted barley, chocolate, oats, slight cream, slight caramel, slight coffee, and light caramel.  Poured pitch black in color with a small, creamy, dense, brown head that lasted around the edges only.  Cloudy.  Opaque.  Slightly sparkling.  Flavor is medium to heavily sweet.  Tastes of chocolate, caramel, slight cream, slight vanilla, and hints of alcohol and roasting.  Medium body.  Chocolate, malt, slight vanilla, slight roasting and slight cream finish is lightly dry, and medium to heavily sweet.  7.2%ABV is a bit noticeable in the flavor.

Tap at the Farmhouse in Burlington. Black pour with a billowing cream colored head. Aroma holds rich amounts of chocolate, coffee, oatmeal, vanilla, and roasted malt. Flavor really brings the oatmeal to the forefront, though the vanilla and chocolate are present enough to provide a wonderful balance. A touch of hop character comes through as well. Palate is delightfully full-bodied and rich, particularly for a non-imperial stout. Amazing stuff.
smooth and substantial in body as well as taste. coffee, vanilla and barley well balanced with some piney style hops. yeasty and thick it tastes alive with a hint of caramel.

In short: A roasted stout with plenty of coffee and plenty of refreshing fruity hops.  Wow!
How: Tap at the brewery
The look: Black body topped by a medium beige head
In long: The strong nose is an admirable mixture of roasted coffee beans and fruity hops that seems to be made for each-other.  Taste is has plenty of very roasted malts, plenty of coffee beans, burnt black cake, a lot of refreshing fruity hops (tropical fruits).  With all that roastiness and fruity hops the finish is both very dry and very refreshing.  Carbonation is appropriately lively.  I could drink this all night long.  I cant believe how well the hopping worked with the coffee in this beer.  First time I get that mixture of coffee and refreshing fruity hops.  This is unfortunately only available in growler at the moment.  A full growler is a lot.  And just because *I can* drink a full growler by myself doesnt mean I wont.

On tap at the Ginger Man, and at Blind Tiger during their Hill Farmstead events.  Pours a deep black with a thin beige to tan head.  Sweet roast, coffee and vanilla on the nose. Smooth chocolate.  Really nice.  Coffee, lightly sweet.  Very  long velvety chocolate finish.  Another really well done beer from Shaun.

Poured a dark brown color with a medium sized off white head. Aromas of some oats, coffee with cream, chocolate, lighter smoke, and caramel. Tastes of the same coffee with cream, caramel, oats, chocolate, and roast.
Pours a deep brown with a creamy deep tan head.  Aroma of coffee, milk chocolate, caramel, toffee and light smoke.  Flavor of coffee, caramel, toffee, nuts, roasted malt, oats and dark chocolate.

Huge fan of this beer. Had on tap and in growlers.

Deep brown/black color with a medium sized, tan head with nice lacing. Aroma is nicely roasted malts, coffee, caramel, and light chocolate. Medium body with highly complex, mature flavors of roasted malts, coffee, cocoa and the perfect touch of hops. 

Pleasantly reminiscent of Mikkeller Beer Geek or the Olbutikken Porter, this is a staple beer in my fridge the last few months.

On tap at Hill Farmstead.
Appearance : Dar black with a small brown head. Not much lacing.

Aroma : Roasted malt with lots of coffee. A bit smokey. A bit fruity. Light citrusy and resinous hops.

Taste : Strong coffee with nice roasted malt. Finish has big notes of coffee with some rubbery phenols. Intense finish. Quite resinous.

Overall : Very nice beer. Very rich taste and nose. Nice strong coffee notes. Still rather drinkable. Great beer !

Nearly opaque black color with a medium sized, tan head that left nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma of roasted malts, burnt oats, coffee, smoke, caramel, and light cocoa.  Taste of roasted malts, coffee, rolled oats, vanilla bean, and a dry finish.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2012 On tap at the brewery. I really wish I knew how to make stout of Danish 

influence. Is it the water? Theres just something so 

delightfully intense about the viscosity, roast, and 

brightness of these kind of stouts. Its got an 

almost pine-like or juniper-scented roast character 

to it that gives it a real terroir. This example is 

very much similar to the Mikkeller Beer Geek, the 

Nogne beers, or the Olbutikken Porter, with really 

amazing density, roast flavor complexity, and a 

mature alcohol profile. Considering that I generally hate coffee in beer, this is a very remarkable example, with a clean, well-integrated and fresh presence thats enjoyable and flavorful. I craved this beer most of 

all at Hill Farmstead.
